fields.description:
When figuring out what issues are affected when merging versions, all issues (whether they have the affects version or fix for version) are put into a single collection.

When looping through the issues we remove the version which is about to be deleted and add the version we are trying to swap for. The problem is that sometimes we erroneously add the affects for version or fix fir version to the issue. That is, we do not check whether the version that is being deleted is actually set for the particular version field before we add the swap version.

The net affect is that when version are merged the new version is set for both the affects version and fix for version, while for some issues it should only be set for one of them.
fields.summary: During version merge an affects version or fix for version will be set even if it is not required

fields.description: This issue is a continuation of JRA-13040.  Could you please add notification for Index Optimization events as well, specifically the ones triggered by hitting the jira.index.max.reindexes limit or the jira.index.update.bulk.optimization limit?
fields.summary: Add logging notification for index optimization events

fields.description: There is a directory named com/atlassian/jira/bc/project/projectOperation in the source code distribution of JIRA.  The case of the directory does not match the case of the package declaration for class files in the directory.  The package declaration is com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.projectoperation (note the lowercase "o" in projectoperation).  While this is not a problem for the Java compiler or most Java IDEs, it does cause Eclipse to complain about the mismatch.  Could the directory be renamed to be consistent with the package name or vice versa?
fields.summary: Name of com/atlassian/jira/bc/project/projectOperation source code directory to be consistent with case of package name

fields.description:
There is an error message displayed ('command' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.) when installing JIRA service manually in Windows 2008 64-bits edition. For example:

\\
{noformat}
C:\Program Files (x86)\JIRA-Enterprise-3.13\bin>service.bat install JIRA
Installing the service 'JIRA' ...
Using CATALINA_HOME: C:\Program Files (x86)\JIRAJIRA-Enterprise-3.13
Using CATALINA_BASE: C:\Program Files (x86)\JIRAJIRA-Enterprise-3.13
Ignoring JAVA_HOME: C:\Progra~2\Java\jdk1.6.0_10
Using JVM: C:\Program Files (x86)\JIRAJIRA-Enterprise-3.13\jre\bin\server\jvm.dll
'command' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
The service 'JIRA' has been installed.
{noformat}

The error message is caused by the {{'command /c'}} statement in {{bin/permgenservice.bat}} file. By referring to this [page|http://www.robvanderwoude.com/command.html], {{"command"}} command is a 16-bits command interpreter and it is not recognizable in Windows server 2008 64-bits edition.
fields.summary: Error when installing JIRA service manually in Windows 2008

fields.description: In the {{OSPropertyString}} entity, the {{value}} field in defined as {{very-long}} which on Oracle 10g is mapped to {{varchar(4000)}}, other database, such as MySQL will use {{TEXT}} which allows a much larger string to be stored. This can cause issues with the charting plugin as it tries to store the properties of a chart in this table that is longer than 4000 characters.
fields.summary: OSPropertyString table should have the value column set to extremely-long datatype

fields.description:
We have code creating groups on the fly as users login, we've seen a case where a group can get created multiple times with the same name.
A guess on a fix is that there could be a synchronized block in the createGroup code to make sure there isn't a race condition between get-create from the database there. There should probably be a unique constraint on group name in the database as well.

Klas Lindfors
Stockholm University

fields.description:
When clicking "Browse project" the URL is say http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/BrowseProject.jspa - although the actual project showed depends on where the user currently is.

This non-REST-ful URL is not bookmarkable and I can't send it an email to anyone. If I have two tabs open then everything gets messed up as there's two current projects.


It's not easy to figure out how to get the corresponding BrowseProject page for the actual project (ie. http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA ).

The link for "Browse project" should go directly to the specific URL ( http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA ) - and the BrowseProject.jspa URL should redirect to /browse/$currentProject.


(In general those .jspa URLs should be avoided, I guess..)
fields.summary: "Browse Project" URL doesn't include current project

fields.description:
{quote}
To reproduce the problem:

1) Select "Find Issues"

2) Select a project and select "View" to list issues within the project

3) Click on the Bulk Change option in the top right

4) In the "Bulk Operation: Choose Issues" page, select several issues and click Next

5) In the "Bulk Operation: Choose Operation" page, select "Edit Issues" and select Next

6) In the "Bulk Operation: Operation Details" page, find a text field. In my database that would be the "Keywords" field. Notice that the checkbox next to "Check Keywords" is unchecked. Type some random text into the text field. Notice that the checkbox next to Change Keywords is now checked This is the expected behavior

7) In the same page, find a field that consists of radio button or is a user picker field. Notics that the checkbox next to the "Change <fieldname>" label is unchecked. Change the selected radio button or the current user in the field. Notice that the checkbox is still unchecked. The expectation is that this checkbox would automatically update to checked if the field contents are modified, indicating that the user would like to make a bulk change to this field.{quote}

I have tested that this happens in this scenario also:

* If the user/group picker icon is used to fill in the user/group picker
* Ticking an option in a multi checkbox
* Using the 'Assign to me' link for the Assignee select list
fields.summary: Some Field Types Do Not Auto-Tick When Modified in Bulk Edit Screen

fields.description:
In 3.12.1, when you went to the Manage Filter screen, the Edit link for each filter takes you to the actual filter in Edit mode (allowing you to adjust the search parameters with one click.)

In 3.13, the Edit link has changed to let you change the name and description of the Filter, un/set it as a Favourite, and share it.  (This is similar to the Rename Filter screen in 3.12.1)

One of our users feels that this is a loss of functionality, as he now has to click to view the filter and then click Edit in the Filter: menu, adding a step.

The thinking is, aren't you more likely to be Editing search parameters of a filter than the name/description?

I suppose one workaround would be to add a second "Edit" link, named "Edit Parameters" or something.  You'd need to get the verbiage correct.

But as it stands now, you've changed the functionality of the link, and that is confusing and annoying.
fields.summary: Edit link on Manage Filters has reduced functionality from 3.12.1 -> 3.13

fields.description:
If one changes projectkey.pattern in a way that the existing project keys don't match any longer there regex pattern, JIRA reports the following error:
{noformat}
ERROR
The project you are trying to view does not exist. Try browsing for projects.
If you think this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions. 
{noformat}

The error is thrown if user try to access any issue from the problematic projects.

Most commonly, this issue is observed in two cases:
# JIRA upgrade - where in the old instance projectkey.pattern was customised and the new instance has the default value.
# Customisation of the parameter - admin user changes the value, but doesn't confirm that all project keys match the pattern in the regex.

In either of these cases users get confused and believe that either issue/project is deleted or there is indexing issue.

The "simplest" resolution would be to modify the error message to be more context specific. Alternatively, in a more complex solution some extra validation would be performed on the used project keys against the previous/default regex value and its current value. Finally, the feedback from this validation would be outputted into  UI and log file.
fields.summary: Misleading error message, if existing project key doesn't match projectkey.pattern

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15851].
  {panel}

I have struggled with installing JIRA on solaris for almost the whole week. I came very close to giving up. I am going to have a go at doing it on Windoze using the standalone JIRA version first. I have found that there is alot more documentation on this. Plus there is a nice windoze install wizard that seems to take you from start to finish. I have high hopes about this.

So my enhancement request is, please provide an install GUI for Unix.

I realise that every Unix machine is different, this may mean that the GUI has to prompt for all sorts of things that are not needed on windoze. But IMO it should still be doable. I also realise it is a pain to have to develop such GUIs because there is no standard infrastructure/machinery for installing stuff on Unix. But the pain I have experienced trying to get JIRA working on solaris is the most amount of pain I have ever experienced setting up software on Unix. Googling just revealed other people experiencing similar amounts of pain in similar areas. Hopefully a nice GUI would make that pain go away.

Linux is slowly moving to install GUIs for complex software. Consider how the kernel or X11 is configured. Although it can be done by editing ASCII config files most people do it through a GUI these days. Over time I think more and more linux software will come with a GUI installer.

I said all this in the JIRA forum and the response was that I should raise an enhancement issue, so here it is. Note that I did eventually get it working on solaris.

Regards,

Andrew Marlow
fields.summary: JIRA on unix would really benefit from a GUI installer

fields.description:
permgen.sh and setenv.sh contain bash-isms that prevent the startup script (startup.sh) from working properly on my Solaris machine. My solaris machine has a vanilla Bourne shell as /bin/sh. This means the bash-isms don't work, I get shell syntax errors when running startup.sh. When I corrected these errors the problems went away and I now have a working JIRA on solaris. Here's what I changed:

1) in permgen.sh change the double square brackets to single square brackets
2) in setenv.sh change the double equals to a single equals

Regards,

Andrew Marlow
fields.summary: JIRA startup.sh fails on solaris due to bash-isms that don't work with the Bourne shell

fields.description:
This is critical for the workflow in JIRA Studio; we cannot proceed without it.

To reproduce:
# Create a new workflow (not by copying, but instead by typing a name and description). You can add steps if you like, but that won't matter.
# Create a new scheme and assign the workflow to that scheme
# create a new project
# assign the scheme to that project
# try to create an issue in that project. You get the following stack trace:

ava.lang.NullPointerException at com.opensymphony.workflow.util.DefaultVariableResolver.translateVariables(DefaultVariableResolver.java:73) at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.createNewCurrentStep(AbstractWorkflow.java:1467) at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1256) at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.initialize(AbstractWorkflow.java:618) at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.SimpleWorkflowManager.createIssue(SimpleWorkflowManager.java:217) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:378) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:326) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at 
....
....
....

Cause:
The ActionDescriptor's unconditional result's old status is null, but opensymphony tries to access it.

Possible solution:
Ensure this is set to somethign non-null by default.
fields.summary: Cannot create issues using a custom workflow

fields.description:
Presently all attachments fall into a single attachment bucket.  It would be more useful if these attachments could be related to a custom field so that they could be properly organized in the field / screen layout.

For example, Description Attachments would be used to describe the problem, possibly w/ screenshots.  Other attachments such as Design/Analysis attachments, Test Steps attachments, and Test Result attachments would all be useful attachment fields.  Having these as custom fields, users can more easily hide and show the relevant attachments for the proper audience on the separate screens/tabs.  Right now although the screen/tab configuration helps do this with normal fields, all of the attachments appear in one location only.  

The benefit is that supporting this in the native custom fields, users can more easily customize their existing fields.  I understand the attachment types are already extendible but this would be a good case where the native attachment function should be available for the custom fields-- without using an unsupported 3rd party component.
fields.summary: Allow attachments field type to be used on custom field associations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15841].
  {panel}

Some people want to share filters in the old way, such that the sharees automatically see that filter in their filter list. 

We have many business users and they seem incapable of doing Manage Filters, Search, entering some params, then clicking the grey stars.

Prior to the upgrade we did have problems with filter and dashboard spam, where people were sharing with too wide a group, so this is an improvement. However in some circumstances we want to share a dashboard/filter and auto-favourite it for the sharees.

Not sure how this would be implemented, eg allow everyone to do this, or just project admins, or add some new permission, or whatever.
fields.summary: Allow the ability to share filters/dashboards rather than the current publish/subscribe model - force favourites

fields.description:
Allow users the option to summarize their email notifications into one email.  

The emails should be delivered at an interval selectable by the user (ie: daily, weekly, fortnightly, monthly, etc).  

A link to an email subscription page should also be added at the bottom of all emails generated by the JIRA system.  The link should lead to the page described above.
fields.summary: Allow users the option to summarize their email notifications into one email.

fields.description:
I'd like to automatically transition an issuetype to new type, WIBNI as a workflow transition.
I've tried this through a jelly script, but this has no effect (don't think it's allowed)
How would I transition this automatically

I.e. user reports a bug, which we determine to be an enhancement request, and transition to this type directly.
Is there any other way to acheieve this?
fields.summary: Change issueType programatically

fields.description:
When adding or deleting a group from permission schemes or notification schemes, the changes are not reflected in the Group Browser page.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new group, "test group".
2. Add the "test group" into one of the project permissions (e.g, Create Issues permission) in a permission scheme (e.g, Default Permission Scheme).
3. Add the "test group" into one of the event in a notification scheme.
4. Navigate back to _Administration -> Users, Groups & Roles -> Group Browser ->_, click on "test group".

You can see that the permission scheme and notification scheme that are using the "test group" do not appear in that page. Please see the attached screenshot.

The problem can only be corrected after JIRA is restarted.
fields.summary: "Caching" issue in Group Browser page

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA 
2. Login as admin user.
3. Click on "User Browser" link.
4. The default value set for "User per page" drop down is 20. Choose any value other than 20 from drop down
5. Click "Filter". It shows the desired number of users per page(depending upon the actual users)
6. Now click on "Reset Filter"

Result:
1. It doesn't set the "User per page" to default value.
2. Here the catch is that we choose any value from the drop down and select "Reset filter" before clicking "Filter", its working fine.

Expected:
1. The value should be reset to the default value as in the case of Group browser window.
fields.summary: The "Reset Filter" link in "User browser" dialog is not working as expected.

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA
2. Login as any standard user.
3. Open the "User profile" dialog by clicking on the username on top bar.
4. Click on "Navigator Columns"
5. Delete all the columns by clicking on trash icon.
6. Once all the column entries are deleted, user gets a link "configure"
7. Click on "Configure"

Result:
1. Nothing happens. The URL its pointing to is "http://localhost:8090/jirauser/secure/$%7Breq.contextPath%7D/secure/ViewUserIssueColumns!default.jspa"
2. But in code a run time error occurs. log is attached

Expected:
1. The URL should be pointing a valid page. Here as the user can just add the columns by clicking on "add new column", I am not sure why we have "configure" link.
fields.summary: Clicking on link "Configure"" after deleting all columns in Navigator columns do nothing

fields.description:
Fogbugz importer silently fails to create new project in JIRA, if the Fogbugz's project name is already used in JIRA with different project key.

The issues are imported to the already existing JIRA project and the _Target project key_ specified in the first step of the import wizard is disregarded.

Steps to reproduce this behaviour:
# There is in JIRA project with the same name as the Fogbugz one but it has different project key.
!beforeImport.png!
# In Fogbugz there is a project with the same name and the importer is config to import it with a different project key.
{noformat}
# written by PropertiesConfiguration
# Thu Oct 23 11:00:34 EST 2008
project.importJIRA = fogbugz
project.Project2 = fogbugz
link.Duplicates = Duplicate
link.BugRelation = related
value.sCategory.Bug = Bug
value.sCategory.Schedule Item = Task
value.sCategory.Inquiry = Task
value.sFullName.Brian Lane = Critical
value.sPriority.Must Fix = Critical
value.sPriority.Fix If Time = Minor
value.sCategory.Feature = New Feature
value.sPriority.Don't Fix = Trivial
{noformat}
# Commit import finally JIRA will report in the UI "The importer has completed successfully without any errors." Also, no errors are reported in the log file check on {{import.log}}
!import.png!

The imported issues are placed in the existing project with its current project key.
fields.summary: Fogbugz importer silently fails to create new project

fields.description:
If in the first step of the importer _Target project key_ is specified to be the same as the project key for already existing project in JIRA, the importer create a new project in JIRA with the duplicating project key.

JIRA before import:
!beforeImport.png!

and JIRA after import:
!afterImport.png!
No errors are reported in the log file or the UI and as of that moment the projects share the project key.

The following config file was used during the import process:
{noformat}
# written by PropertiesConfiguration
# Thu Oct 23 10:45:04 EST 2008
project.importJIRA = fogbugz
link.Duplicates = Duplicate
link.BugRelation = related
value.sCategory.Bug = Bug
value.sCategory.Schedule Item = Task
value.sCategory.Inquiry = Task
value.sFullName.Brian Lane = Critical
value.sPriority.Must Fix = Critical
value.sPriority.Fix If Time = Minor
value.sCategory.Feature = New Feature
value.sPriority.Don't Fix = Trivial
{noformat}
fields.summary: Fogbugz importer allows to dupicat existing project key in JIRA

fields.description:
If you have two field configuration schemes, one with more fields, and you move an issue from the more fields scheme to the less fields scheme, the issue will no longer have values for the fields. This is OK and by design.

However, what is also supposed to happen is that change history items should be created for all the fields that do not exist in the target field configuration scheme. The change history items should indicate the old value and the new (absent) value.

If the issue being moved has subtasks and they also move field configuration schemes as a result of the (/) _also move subtasks_ option, these subtasks *do* get their proper change history items.
fields.summary: Move Issue fails to create change history items for values not in target field configuration scheme

fields.description:
I need developer help to verify this customer's comment:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customizing+text?focusedCommentId=169607212#comment-169607212

Basically the customer has said that the *language_en_UK.jar* should be removed from JIRA standalone when customising text. The statement he is referring to is:
{quote}
_If you are using the WAR/Webapp distribution of JIRA, you should extract the jar from webapp/WEB-INF/lib to edit-webapp/WEB-INF/classes and remove the webapp/WEB-INF/lib/language_default.jar and (if using English) webapp/WEB-INF/lib/language_en_UK.jar (using the correct jar for your language)._
{quote}

Please verify and I will update the document accordingly.
fields.summary: Please Verify:  language_en_UK.jar should be removed from JIRA standalone when customising text
record issue resolver

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15818].
  {panel}

Hi.
We have found a little bit unexpected behavior with an email handling.
For example, we have a configured Email handler for projectKey=PROJECT_A. This handler processes email message with a PROJECT_B-1234 issue key in message subject. So, handler adds this message as a comment for the PROJECT_B-1234 issue instead of creating a new ticket for the project PROJECT_A. 
Is this a correct flow? Is there any way to change the handler behavior via some configuration parameters (without changing of the Jira source code)?
Thanks.
fields.summary: Make CreateOrCommentHandler project parameter apply to issue commenting as well as to issue creation (as a configuration parameter)

fields.description:
During a bulk move it may be necessary to select a new reporter when moving issues between projects. It is possible to enter in a user that does not have create issue permission for the target project. In this case JIRA just sets the reporter to this value for all applicable issues even though it is invalid for the target project.

This does not appear to cause any other errors, JIRA continues to work as expected.
fields.summary: Possible to set reporter to invalid user during bulk move.

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/jdk/download.jsp

fields.description:
We have identified various errors in relations to the Japanese translations in JIRA 3.13, and have compiled a list of the ones which we believe to be problematic, in a lot of cases these are just grammar and wording changes, while in other cases it is a mistranslation, and in rare cases, some were not translated at all. Please review this list and contact me if there are any issues in regards to the content within this list.

Note that some of the corrections listed within this table links to other issues which I have raised (JRA-15735 and JRA-15699).

The most problematic ones from what I have noticed are:
1. "with open issues due to be fixed per version" - which is not translated within the Japanese language pack
2. "A change log of the recent versions for this project " - which was caused by an error in the i18 parameter name within the com\atlassian\jira\plugins\projectpanels\changelog_ja_JP.properties file, the properties should be projectpanels.changelog.description and projectpanels.changelog.name as opposed to componentpanels.changelog.description and componentpanels.changelog.name

We are currently working on modifying the Japanese language pack as an interim fix that includes the changes detailed in this issue while we wait for the official fixes.
fields.summary: Japanese Translation Problems in JIRA 3.13

fields.description:
We need to have the ability to configure a field that points to another field that Jira current doesn't have the ability to do so.

Here is the layout:

Field A: lab1, lab2, lab3
Field B would be: 
 - lab1: eng1, eng2, eng3
 - lab2: eng4, eng5, eng6
 - lab3: eng7, eng8, eng9

Field B: is based on selection of Field A. If lab1 is selected then Field B would have eng1, eng2, eng3. If lab2 is selected, then Field B would have eng4, eng5, eng6. If lab3 is selected then Field B would have eng7, eng8, eng9.

We have seen this scenerio in the Project and Issue type relationship where the Issue type is based on the Project. We would like to have the same ability to create similar cascaded fields for the issue.
fields.summary: Cascading custom field to another custom field

fields.description: We need to have the ability to assign issue to a group of people in an auto rotation format. The auto rotation would work in round-robin. We have a list of support engineers and would like to have issues assign to them automatically in round-robin. Currently we don't see any option in Jira to allow us to do that.
fields.summary: Ability to assign issue to a round-robin auto rotation group

fields.description:
Trying to add a new context to a custom field produces an entry in the log file of the form {{[webwork.view.taglib.IteratorTag] Value is null! Returning an empty set.}} This normally indicates that some form of Java exception is being thrown and eventually swallowed by a webwork tag.

This does not appear to affect the page in any visual way. It does not stop the user from adding a context.
fields.summary: Adding a new context to a custom field produces "[webwork.view.taglib.IteratorTag] Value is null! Returning an empty set"

fields.description:
When bulk moving issues between projects, it may be necessary to change the reporter. When this occurs there is an option to 'Retain' the old assigned user where possible. This option can be turned on/off. 

The screen does not seem to remember what this option is was set to when an error occurs

For example (see the attached video):

# Try to bulk move some issues into a project such that their reporter must be changed, 
# Click retain but do not give a reporter. This should give an error. 
# Check the "retain" option for the reporter, but do not give a reporter. This should give an error.
# Uncheck the "retain" option for the reporter, but do no give a reporter. This will give an error, but somehow the retain option is set again.
fields.summary: Looks like it is not possible to unselect retain when bulk moving an issue.

after cklick on the button the same screen is shown without any exception or info message.

Changing to English (UK) works as workaround.{quote}

fields.description:
In using JIRA for the purposes of technical support, we would like to limit the visibility of issues to the Reporter and Internal Staff.  We have created an Issue Security Scheme with this security level, and set the security level as the default for the Issue Security Scheme.  We have then associated the Issue Security Scheme to the technical support project.

The presence of the Issue Security field on the screen unnecessarily raises the anxiety level of customers who fear that human error may accidentally reveal their issues to other customers.  So as to reduce this problem, we would like to hide the Issue Security field using the Field Configurations administration page.  (Using the Field Configurations administration page is less work and far more preferable to customizing JIRA's webwork source code.)

Unfortunately, when the Issue Security field is hidden in the Field Configurations administration page, issues that should have otherwise been assigned a security level of Reporter and Internal Staff by default are instead created with no security level.  Showing the Issue Security field restores proper function by having newly created issues assigned a security level of Reporter and Internal Staff.

I fear that this problem may also affect other hidden fields created to maintain internal information that we would choose not to show to end users.
fields.summary: Hiding Issue Security field in Field Configurations prevents default security level of project Issue Security Scheme from being assigned to newly created issues

fields.description:
Currently JIRA allows two or more users to edit issue reports simultaneously.  The last person to save the issue report will have their changes retained by JIRA while all other changes will be lost.

DESIRED: JIRA should disable issue editing for all other users if someone has already begun editing an issue, or at least deliver a warning that someone is already editing the issue.
fields.summary: Jira should not allow more than one user to edit an issue report at any given time
Full Management of Versions through SOAP

When I set a filter over different issue types, and then customize the issue navigator to show these custom fields, only the custom fields are shown that are included in ALL the issue types over which the filter was set. I would like the issue navigator to generally show all custom fields, even if they are not included in certain issue types. These should be greyed out or left blank.

fields.description:
Some data was added to a backup by 3.12.3 that made that backup unusable for 3.13. The relevant difference between the two backups is 
related to FishEye:

{noformat}
mdoar@svn4:~/bchop> diff old/2008-Sep-08--1347.xml new/2008-Sep-09--0148.xml | grep -i fisheye
>     <OSPropertyEntry id="10487" entityName="jira.properties" entityId="1" propertyKey="jira.plugin.state-.com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye:crucible-issuepanel" type="5"/>
>     <OSPropertyEntry id="10483" entityName="jira.properties" entityId="1" propertyKey="jira.plugin.state-.com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye:crucible-projectpanel" type="5"/>
>     <OSPropertyEntry id="10484" entityName="jira.properties" entityId="1" propertyKey="jira.plugin.state-.com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye:perforceManager" type="5"/>
>     <OSPropertyEntry id="10485" entityName="jira.properties" entityId="1" propertyKey="jira.plugin.state-.com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye:perforceConfig" type="5"/>
>     <OSPropertyEntry id="10486" entityName="jira.properties" entityId="1" propertyKey="jira.plugin.state-.com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye:createjob-function" type="5"/>
>     <OSPropertyEntry id="10488" entityName="jira.properties" entityId="1" propertyKey="jira.plugin.state-.com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye:cruciblecharting" type="5"/>
{noformat}

and importing the second backup produces errors with 3.13 during an attempted import that contained the exception:

{noformat}
earlier/logs/catalina.out:2008-10-14 19:30:49,289 main FATAL [atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyLauncher] A RuntimeException occurred during ConsistencyLauncher 
  servlet context initialisation - com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.config.RefreshManager doesn't have any satisfiable constructors. 
  Unsatisfiable dependencies: [[interface com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.ChangeSetManager, interface com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.config.FishEyeConfig,
 interface com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.config.FishEyeInstanceStore, interface com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.config.RepositoryPathStore,
 interface com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.perforce.PerforceConfig, interface com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.perforce.PerforceManager,
 interface com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.config.CustomQueryStore, interface com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.config.FishEyeRepositoryStore,
 interface com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye.FishEyeManager]].
{noformat}

This does not occur with the first backup file.

The reason that I have filed this as a blocker is that it stops people from upgrading from 3.12.3 to 3.13. A workaround is to remove the jira-fisheye plugin jar file from a new 3.13 installation.
fields.summary: Data added to a backup by JIRA related to FishEye caused breakages with JIRA

fields.description:
Afrer upgradeing from 3.12 to 3.13 we found that

Multiple services "create/comment issue" with different catchmail address on single mailbox works differently than in 3.12.*

In old version Jira, These services skip messages with another than catchmail address in filed "from", now if one service run earlier than other - it deletes all mail in mailbox.

workaround:

run only one services per server. :(

I think it must be documented.
fields.summary: Problem in logic when using multiple mail services "create issue"

13 Oct 2008 21:25:41,522 DEBUG TP-Processor7 SecurityFilter : requiredRoles = [use]
13 Oct 2008 21:25:41,523 DEBUG TP-Processor7 DefaultAuthenticator: Session found; user : 'jroper' already logged in
13 Oct 2008 21:25:41,523 INFO  TP-Processor7 SecurityFilter : User 'jroper' needs (and lacks) role 'use' to access /secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=jroper
{noformat}

This is counter intuitive, an administrator should be able to at least do anything that a user can do.  Additionally, giving a group that jroper is in use permissions is not an option, because that means when users sign up, they will automatically be added to that group (why????  what does the list of groups that have use permission have to do with default groups for a new user?), but in this case, JIRA is using extranet crowd, and so new sign ups go into a different directory to the directory that jroper came from (atlassian staff), and so new sign ups will fail because the groups in the atlassian staff directory don't exist on the external directory.
fields.summary: Users with admin permission do not have permission to use everything in JIRA
